Description: Rim and body fragment of North Ionian pottery bird bowl; interior: glazed with narrow band of added purple framed by narrow white stripes in upper third and reserved band in lower third of fragment; exterior: bird with hatched body placed between two quatrefoil rosettes and upper part of a ray underneath; pendent hatched triangle below the rim; two groups of thin vertical lines on either side of the main decorative field; top of rim on exterior glazed. Light brown clay with numerous lime inclusions.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See also J. N. Coldstream, Greek Geometric Pottery (London 1968), p. 301, no 35 (Group IV, after 615 BC).
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 255, no. 2)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. I.8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.077)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.30)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
